column4: I had to forcefully stop an apt - how can I free the administration directory?
usually this command does that: sudo apt-get update
Ok my connection dropped out and I had to forcefully stop that too >.<
hm? I didn't understand, can you do once more: sudo apt-get update
I know what causes it and there was a command to unlock the directory
But I forgot what it is

Could not open lock file
2009-02-19T02:21:00.000Z	savvas	The_Joe_	Could not open lock file" ?
then: sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get upgrade
sudo apt-get update finishes but then gives me the same error "/
how about this: ps aux | grep -i apt
ubottu seems to have given me something - I'll try that
